Selena.Action: Throws Molotov cocktails to protect Jim from the Infected, actively intervening to help.
Uses Molotov cocktails effectively to stop the Infected and protect Jim.
Appears confident and prepared, carrying a machete and backpack, indicating readiness and skill.
Leads Jim into a side street to safety, helps him move quickly.
Secures entry into the newsagent's shop by prising open the grill to access shelter.
Pries away the metal grill over the door lock enough to slip her hand through and open the latch, enabling entry into the shop.
Carries a lit Molotov cocktail and a machete, prepared for combat and survival.
Has established a makeshift bed of sheets and sleeping bag in the back of the shop, showing resourcefulness and ability to create a safe resting place.
Ignores Mark's comment and focuses on the situation calmly, telling Jim the harsh reality about the infection and the dead families.
Warns Jim that his family will be dead too, showing blunt honesty but little emotional comfort.
Takes off her mask promptly, indicating readiness and awareness of the situation.
Correctly identifies Mark as a patient, not a doctor, showing good judgment.
Clearly and calmly explains the situation and the nature of the infection to Jim, demonstrating knowledge and communication skills.
Ignores Mark's attempt at humor, focusing on the seriousness of the situation, showing emotional control and focus.
Delivers grim news about the infection and the fate of families, showing realism and no false hope.
Encourages Jim by telling him 'You'll go and come back.'
Insists that Jim will go and come back, showing confidence in his ability and the plan.
Follows Mark and Jim along the train tracks, moving cautiously with the group.
Scans the house carefully and expresses concern about anyone who isn't human inside.
Gestures upwards to indicate direction to Jim and Mark, cooperating silently.
Sniffs the air and recoils, showing sensitivity to danger and alerting the group non-verbally.
Scans the dark facade of the house carefully before entering, showing caution and awareness.
Sniffs the air at the top of the stairs and recoils, indicating alertness to danger.
Gestures upwards to indicate the next move, coordinating with Jim.
Watches Jim with a neutral expression after he sees his parents' bodies and expresses grief.
Tells Jim 'They died peacefully. You should be grateful.' in response to his grief.
Suggests staying in the house for safety instead of returning to the shop before dark.
Offers to share a room with Mark for safety.
Climbs on top of a kiosk to get a better view and assess the situation.
Recognizes the danger of returning to the shop before dark and suggests staying put for the night.
Proposes that she and Jim sleep in the same room for safety.
Arrives suddenly to save Jim from an Infected attacker by killing the assailant with her machete.
Arrives suddenly and kills the attacking Infected Man with a machete, saving Jim.
Asks Jim repeatedly if he was bitten or exposed to infected blood, showing concern for his safety.
Holds her machete ready, prepared to defend against threats, indicating vigilance but also a guarded stance.
Attacks Mark with her machete after seeing blood on his arm and a fresh wound, despite his protests, showing mistrust and aggression.
Maintains control and steel in her voice despite hyperventilating, asks critical questions about infection risk.
Holds machete at the ready, prepared to defend against threats.
Attacks Mark after seeing blood on his arm and a fresh wound, acting decisively to neutralize a potential threat.
Swipes machete twice at Mark, injuring him despite his protests, showing possible over-aggression or lack of communication.
Brutally finishes off Mark to protect herself and Jim.
Tosses a dishcloth to Jim to clean off the blood, showing practical concern for him.
Urgently instructs Jim to get dressed and prepare to leave, demonstrating protective leadership.
Silently avoids explaining how she knew Mark was infected when questioned by Jim.
Brutally finishes off Mark quickly and decisively.
Immediately organizes Jim to clean the blood and change clothes, showing quick situational awareness.
Efficiently gathers supplies with practiced speed, indicating preparedness and skill.
Keeps calm and focused while moving quickly and alertly with Jim, showing confidence and control.
Does not explain how she knew Mark was infected when questioned, withholding information.
Admits she did not know Mark was infected, showing honesty but also a gap in knowledge.
States she would kill an infected loved one immediately to prevent danger.
Describes plans and survival pragmatically, showing detachment and dispassion.
Cuts Jim off without looking back, indicating brusqueness.
Notices the fairy lights and signals Jim to be quiet, showing awareness and protective caution.
Clearly explains the critical time window to kill an infected person, showing understanding of the situation's urgency.
Describes practical defensive measures (long-distance weapons, metal grills, petrol bombs) indicating tactical thinking.
Cuts off Jim before he speaks, showing situational awareness and control of the moment.
Dismisses plans as pointless and focuses on survival, which could be seen as realistic but also potentially defeatist.
Offers to take a break and shows concern when Jim admits to a headache, giving him a 'cut-the-crap' expression to encourage honesty.
Explores the damaged building carefully using a flashlight, assesses obstacles like the jammed lift and tangled shopping trolleys, and finds a way to climb through the gap.
Moves steadily and quietly with Jim, checks corners before proceeding, showing caution and awareness.
Offers to take a break and notices Jim's condition, showing attentiveness and leadership.
Does not immediately respond to Jim's headache, but presses him to be honest, indicating emotional intelligence and communication skills.
Gives Jim codeine tablets and offers him a choice of sugary drinks to help him recover.
Responds calmly and quietly to a sudden scream, showing composure under pressure.
Assesses Jim's condition accurately and offers appropriate medical aid using looted supplies.
Recognizes the nature of the scream as an infected and understands the threat quickly.
Responds calmly and quietly to the threat, preparing for confrontation.
Encourages Jim to keep moving despite exhaustion ('Come on!')
Runs alongside Jim, facing danger together
Calls out to the girl to let them in, showing trust and seeking help
Continues urging Jim to keep moving despite his exhaustion, showing determination and leadership.
Runs up the stairs quickly and keeps pace with Jim, demonstrating physical capability and stamina.
Follows the Riot Gear Man's direction to run down the corridor to Flat 157, showing ability to take and act on instructions under pressure.
Both she and Jim are stunned momentarily by the Riot Gear Man's sudden appearance and actions, indicating a brief hesitation or surprise.
Introduces herself politely and shakes hands with Frank, helping to ease tension.
Gestures to the sofa inviting Jim to sit, attempting to create a comfortable atmosphere.
Greets Frank confidently and initiates sitting down on the sofa, attempting to create a comfortable atmosphere.
Appears rattled and uncertain about what to expect from Frank, showing some hesitation.
Expresses gratitude to Frank for their hospitality.
Acknowledges the danger outside and the loss of others who left the building.
Expresses gratitude politely and acknowledges the situation clearly with concise statements like 'We're grateful' and 'It's a good set-up.'
Asks relevant questions about the presence of others outside and in the building, showing awareness and concern for safety.
Does not take any visible initiative or offer solutions during the conversation, remaining mostly reactive and passive.
Says she would leave behind desperate people who might slow them down.
Acknowledges Jim's gratitude but keeps interaction brief and somewhat distant.
Assesses the situation pragmatically, prioritizing survival over sentimentality by suggesting leaving behind those who slow them down.
Decides to get some sleep after a tense conversation, showing self-care and awareness of her limits.
Hesitates at the door before responding to Jim, indicating some internal conflict or uncertainty.
Responds with 'We.' indicating willingness to join and support the group journey.
Expresses amazement at the idea of soldiers protecting survivors, showing openness and hope.
Listens attentively to the radio broadcast and processes the information about the soldiers and their location.
Asserts 'We' when discussing the journey, indicating willingness to take responsibility and be part of the group effort.
Does not interrupt or challenge Frank's assessment of the situation, showing deference but also possibly passivity.
Expresses realistic skepticism about the soldiers and the possibility of a cure, showing caution and concern for the group's safety.
Acknowledges the risk of dying trying to reach the soldiers, implicitly valuing the lives of the group members.
Expresses realistic skepticism about the soldiers' recording and the possibility of a cure, showing critical thinking.
Acknowledges the risks involved in trying to reach the soldiers, indicating awareness of danger.
Identifies the tunnel as the most direct route to the other side of the river.
Stands alert with Jim, weapons ready, shining flashlight into darkness to protect the group.
Calmly informs the group that the rats are running from the infected, helping others understand the danger.
Identifies that the rats are running from the infected, showing awareness of the situation.
Strains to help lift the cab to free Hannah, showing teamwork and effort under pressure.
Notices the supermarket and insists on stopping, indicating concern for the group's well-being and survival.
Helps lift the cab to free Hannah, showing physical effort and teamwork under pressure.
Notices something important outside the cab and promptly tells the driver to stop, demonstrating alertness and quick decision-making.
Insists on getting food and drink from the supermarket for the group despite risks, showing concern for group's needs.
Takes multiple cans off the shelves enthusiastically, like a child in a toy store.
Advises Jim not to take items they don't need to cook, showing consideration for group's resources.
Decides to get out of the cab and enter the supermarket despite uncertainty, showing initiative and confidence.
Identifies the supermarket as a valuable resource (a 'gold mine') and focuses on essential supplies like food and drink.

Gives practical instructions to not take anything they need to cook, showing foresight and practical knowledge.

Notices a potential problem with the traffic jam on the Westway and voices concern.
Engages in lighthearted banter about chocolate, showing normal social interaction but no particular skill or intelligence.
Tells Jim to stay close, showing concern for his safety.
Not impressed by Jim's flashy bat flip, indicating disapproval but no hostility.
Questions Jim about going to the cafe and insists they have enough food.
Does not press Jim further or show frustration when he gives short answers about the cafe search.
Questions Jim's decision to go to the cafe, indicating awareness of resource sufficiency.
Accepts Jim's negative report without pressing further or showing concern.
Observes the interactions and body language of others attentively during the drive, indicating situational awareness and thoughtfulness.
Remains mostly silent and reflective during the long drive, not taking active leadership or decision-making roles.
Laughs along with others at Jim's joke, sharing a light moment.
Drinks from a can of tinned peaches messily, showing relaxed and natural behavior among the group.
Reflects on the meaning of survival and family, showing empathy towards Frank and Hannah's situation.
Shares a tender moment with Jim, giving him a light kiss on the cheek and smiling.
Reflects thoughtfully on the situation and revises her earlier pessimistic view, showing emotional insight and adaptability.
Engages in a calm, meaningful conversation with Jim, demonstrating social awareness and confidence.
Does not take any direct action to improve their survival situation in this excerpt, focusing instead on emotional reflection.
Shares Valium pills with Jim to help them sleep.
Falls asleep quickly while others remain awake and worried.

Falls asleep quickly and easily despite the unsafe environment, relying on medication.
Leans against the cab, chewing a chocolate bar while others prepare and check equipment.
Observes the burning city and notes the absence of fire crews to put it out.
Advises against using the horn to avoid attracting the wrong kind of attention.
Advises against using the horn to avoid attracting the wrong kind of attention at a military blockade.
Expresses concern about attracting the wrong kind of attention.
Stands apart from others while they investigate, quietly handling camouflage webbing and then letting it drop back inside.

Pulls out camouflage webbing but then lets it drop back inside without further action or explanation.
Expresses concern and suggests leaving the dangerous area.
Agrees with Frank's suggestion to leave after assessing the situation.

Stands back and does not intervene during Frank's escalating distress and aggression.

Commands Jim to kill infected Frank, showing decisiveness in a crisis but also emotional harshness.
Lets Hannah go after restraining her, allowing her to approach her dead father, showing sensitivity to Hannah's grief.

Holds Hannah back to prevent her from lunging towards infected Frank, showing control in a tense situation.

Lets Hannah go after Frank is shot, recognizing the situation and allowing her to process shock.

Lies protectively over Hannah, signaling Jim to be quiet by putting a finger to her lips.

Notices Hannah is not eating and quietly points it out, showing awareness and concern.

Sitting dressed and awake next to Hannah when Jim bursts in, showing readiness and alertness.

Sits calmly on the sofa despite tense and dangerous situation, showing composure.

Shakes Hannah by the shoulders, urging her to get out of danger and stay alert despite Hannah being spaced out and doped up.

Follows Mitchell's lead without hesitation when he orders to move upstairs quickly.

Calls out for Hannah despite the danger, showing concern but potentially risking alerting the Infected.
Squirming out of Mitchell's grip to take control of the situation.
Not immediately grabbing her machete which is nearby, potentially missing an opportunity to arm herself quickly.
Hesitates to kill Jim despite his violent behavior, showing internal conflict and restraint.

Tells Hannah to stop attacking Jim, showing concern and a calming influence.

Attempts to calm Hannah down by telling her to stop attacking Jim, showing some control over the situation.
